<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning and Happy Cinco de Mayo. </strong>Jerry Seinfeld returns with a Netflix standup special tonight, and given the circumstances, we’re hoping for the most mundane, trivial, radically inconsequential observations of daily life Jerry can muster. Here are a few especially relatable quotes from the sitcom:<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"How come people don't have dip for dinner? Why is it only a snack, why can't it be a meal, you know?"</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"What is it about sleep that makes you so thirsty? Do dreams require liquid? It's not like I'm running a marathon, I'm just lying there."</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And especially relevant today, here’s this from Newman: “Tuesday has no feel. Monday has a feel, Friday has a feel, Sunday has a feel..."</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Are you feeling anything? </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/04/carnival-announces-plans-resume-sailing?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Cruise? In This Pandemic?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Cruise line" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84MjkvY3J1aXNlX2xpbmUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In big news for ABBA cover bands and people who prefer not to fully rub in their sunscreen, Carnival Cruise Line <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/04/coronavirus-carnival-cruise-line-says-it-will-sail-again-august-1.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> it will resume sailing from select ports on August 1. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The stern story</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The cruise industry came under fire early in the pandemic for allowing the coronavirus to spread unchecked. 22% of active ships <a href="https://www.miamiherald.com/news/business/tourism-cruises/article241914096.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> infections, according to the Miami Herald, and the Carnival-operated Diamond Princess had one of the earliest, and at the time biggest, outbreaks outside of China. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In early March, Carnival scrambled to soothe customer fears, </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-08/carnival-cruises-offering-free-drinks-to-guests-who-don-t-cancel?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">offering free drinks</a></span><span> to passengers who didn't cancel their reservations. But the CDC later dropped the anchor, instituting and then extending a “no sail order'' until July 24. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Customers filed lawsuits seeking damages from Carnival, the operator responsible for 69% of total cruise ship cases. Now, Congress is <a href="https://www.foxbusiness.com/markets/congress-carnival-cruises-coronavirus-response?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stepping in</a> with its own investigation into Carnival's handling of the outbreaks.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">High seas, low prices</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Carnival's trying to weather a sea of animosity by offering August trips for as little as $28 a day, which for some is <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-05-04/carnival-cruise-line-to-resume-sailing-aug-1-after-virus-halt?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cheaper than staying home</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Those bargain deals reflect the long road ahead for the broader travel industry. Take your pick from a buffet of <a href="https://apnews.com/c5ad53fbaf1c2380d88508243ec51860?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scary numbers</a>:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Global travel demand won't reach its normal pace until 2023, according to estimates from Tourism Economics.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Trips of at least one night are expected to fall 30% this year after a record 1.5 billion in 2019.  </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>8 million U.S. workers whose jobs were related to tourism are now jobless, which represents about one-third of total unemployment.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Carnival has not yet disclosed what precautions it will be taking to prevent further outbreaks. Until it does, $28/day cruises might not be enough to dispel passenger fears of jumping aboard another floating petri dish. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/04/amazon-exec-resigns-activist-firings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Amazon Exec: "I Quit in Dismay"
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Working at Amazon is nice, but living with a clear conscience is better, said a prominent VP who <a href="https://www.tbray.org/ongoing/When/202x/2020/04/29/Leaving-Amazon?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">resigned</a> from the company's cloud division Friday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The high-ranking software engineer, Tim Bray, said he was leaving over the company's firings of warehouse workers who spoke up about unsafe working conditions during the COVID-19 pandemic. Bray also mentioned the firing of two Amazon corporate employees who pressed the company over its environmental impact.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Amazon says these employees were fired for violating company policies, not their activism. Bray thinks otherwise, describing the activist firings as "designed to create a climate of fear." </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>As Recode <a href="https://www.vox.com/recode/2020/5/4/21246361/amazon-vp-tim-bray-resigns-activist-firing-aws?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">points out</a>, Amazon doesn't hand out the VP badge like a participation trophy—only the upper echelon of managers earn the title. So when a BFD like Bray writes that "Amazon treats the humans in the warehouses as fungible units of pick-and-pack potential," it shows that the company's ruthless drive for efficiency isn't shared by all members of the leadership team. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/04/robinhood-valued-83b-latest-round?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Plot Twist: Robinhood Keeps the Money
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Robinhood" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=347 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/JSq7Rl488lMwaKOqYh/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Robinhood" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/JSq7Rl488lMwaKOqYh/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Robinhood, the app you know you shouldn't check constantly but you can't help yourself, <a href="https://blog.robinhood.com/news/2020/5/4/robinhood-raises-280-million-in-series-f-funding-led-by-sequoia?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> a $280 million fundraising round that brings the investing platform's valuation to $8.3 billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>After <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/02/robinhood-goes-historic-day-stock-market?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">major glitches</a> in early March cost customers action during a historic market rally, Robinhood beefed up capacity. Something worked, because it's added 3 million funded accounts this year (it reported 10 million total in December). In March, daily trading volume was nearly triple Q4 2019's average. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Solidifying Robinhood's status as first base for individual investors, half of new customers are newbies. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What about an IPO?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Many speculated Robinhood would ring the bell this year, but some analysts are skeptical of its business model. Robinhood earns some revenue by investing customers' cash balances—but that brings in less money now that the Fed gave interest rates a quarantine buzz cut.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">CEO Vlad Tenev told Fortune he's <a href="https://fortune.com/2020/05/04/robinhood-funding-series-f-global-expansion-sequoia-capital/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">moving forward</a> with international expansion. Robinhood recently delayed plans for a U.K. launch, but 150,000 customers are hanging on the waiting list. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Before the pandemic, Robinhood was the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/07/robinhood-clear-leader-among-investment-apps-analysis-shows?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">leader</a> among investment apps. This round shows investors haven't stopped believing.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/04/j-crew-files-bankruptcy-protection?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
J. Crew Goes Overboard
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday morning, J. Crew <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/05/04/849960419/j-crew-bankruptcy-filing-may-not-be-the-last-for-retailers-slammed-by-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed</a> for Chapter 11 bankruptcy. The apparel chain will keep operations running while working with creditors to tame $1.7 billion in debt and spruce up a brand that's lost its <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/03/business/j-crew-bankruptcy-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">crisp linen edge</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it's a big deal: </strong>J. Crew is the pandemic's first major retail casualty. But with most U.S. stores shuttered, legions of furloughed workers, and a consumer base content with alternating between two pairs of sweats, it won't be the last.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Who might be next? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Men's apparel company J. Hilburn <a href="https://www.dallasnews.com/business/retail/2020/05/04/dallas-mens-custom-brand-j-hilburn-files-for-bankruptcy/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed</a> for bankruptcy yesterday. And women's retailer J. Jill is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/womens-apparel-company-j-jill-taps-restructuring-advisers-after-closing-stores-11588349398?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">talking</a> with financial advisers. Moral of the story: Find a different initial. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Other members of the Big Khaki crew, including JCPenney, Belk, and Brooks Brothers, are <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/04/business/j-crew-bankruptcy-jcpenney-sears-neiman-marcus-retailers-coronavirus/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">potential</a> candidates. Many were closing stores before the outbreak. And don't forget about...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Macy's, which also brought on financial advisors. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Neiman Marcus, which is shaking under $4.3 billion in debt.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line, </strong>per <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Retail Brew</a> writer Halie LeSavage: "A wave of retail bankruptcies would've eventually arrived due to preexisting financial troubles—the current crisis is just accelerating them."</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/04/selection-2020-pulitzer-winners?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Coming in Hot With Pulitzer-Worthy Reading Recs
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Klay Thompson" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=378 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/46zOV8ktcfyOArbTE4/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Klay Thompson" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/46zOV8ktcfyOArbTE4/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We missed out on the Pulitzer <em>again</em> this year, but you know what—it’s ok because there are so many deserving winners. Here are a few selections from yesterday’s announcement so you can enjoy their work:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Investigative reporting: </strong>Brian Rosenthal of the NYT <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/19/nyregion/nyc-taxis-medallions-suicides.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dug deep</a> into the taxi industry in NYC to reveal its rotten core of predatory lenders. Also comes with an accompanying <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/28/podcasts/the-daily/what-actually-happened-to-new-yorks-taxi-drivers.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">podcast episode from </a><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/28/podcasts/the-daily/what-actually-happened-to-new-yorks-taxi-drivers.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Daily</em></a><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/28/podcasts/the-daily/what-actually-happened-to-new-yorks-taxi-drivers.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"></a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Explanatory reporting: </strong>the WaPo’s series documenting the effects of climate change. Three highlights from the series...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Extreme climate change </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2019/national/climate-environment/climate-change-america/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is here</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Qatar has begun to </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2019/world/climate-environment/climate-change-qatar-air-conditioning-outdoors/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">air-condition the outdoors</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>They </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2019/national/climate-environment/climate-change-alaska/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">just can’t quit</a></span><span> Big Oil</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">National reporting: </strong>A crew at The Seattle Times exposed <a href="https://www.seattletimes.com/business/boeing-737-max-crisis-2019-news-coverage/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">software flaws</a> in Boeing’s 737 Max and the lax oversight of the FAA. They split the prize with ProPublica's investigation into the Navy's 7th Fleet. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Public service: </strong>The Anchorage Daily News with support from ProPublica found one in three Alaska villages have <a href="https://www.adn.com/alaska-news/lawless/2019/05/16/lawless-one-in-three-alaska-villages-have-no-local-police/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">no local police</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">General nonfiction: </strong><a href="https://www.pulitzer.org/winners/anne-boyer?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Undying</em></a> by Anne Boyer (a memoir about cancer care in the U.S.) and <a href="https://www.pulitzer.org/winners/greg-grandin?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The End of the Myth</em></a><em> </em>by Greg Grandin (exploring the symbolism of the American “frontier”).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">See the rest of the winners <a href="https://www.pulitzer.org/prize-winners-by-year?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tech Tip Tuesday: </strong>The 30 <a href="https://exceljet.net/lessons/30-excel-shortcuts-in-12-minutes" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most useful Excel shortcuts</a> in one 12-minute video</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">New pod episode: </strong>Like baseball and apple pie, capitalism is part of the American way of life. But how long can this mashup of free markets x democracy last? <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">On National Teacher Day,</strong> here are some stories about educators going above and beyond during the pandemic:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The teacher who </span><span><a href="https://fox11online.com/news/local/appleton-teacher-runs-40-miles-in-a-month-to-go-past-students-homes-and-leave-notes" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ran 40 miles</a></span><span> in a month to send notes to her students</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The teacher who sat in her student’s driveway to </span><span><a href="https://www.insideedition.com/kind-teacher-sits-outside-with-student-struggling-over-coronavirus-pandemic-58991" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cheer her up</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Every teacher who's </span><span><a href="https://www.edutopia.org/video/educators-say-good-morning-students-video" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">still saying</a></span><span> “Good morning” with a smile</span>

</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Do you know a teacher who’s getting ultra creative during COVID-19? <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Over the weekend, Icelandic strong man Hafþór Björnsson aka "The Mountain" from <em>Game of Thrones</em> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2020/may/02/hafthor-bjornsson-game-of-thrones-mountain-breaks-world-deadlift-record?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">deadlifted 1,104 lbs</a> to set a new world record. In between asking why someone would spend their weekend lifting the equivalent of a small elephant, we found that tiny Iceland has found enormous success in strength competitions.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What other countries have a stranglehold on certain sports? Sounds like a great quiz to us. Using Quartz’s “<a href="https://qz.com/753605/china-is-better-at-table-tennis-than-any-country-is-at-any-olympic-sport/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Dominance Score</a>” as a measure, we'll give you the sport and you have to name the country that's dominated it at recent Olympics. </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Table tennis</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Archery</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Softball</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Judo</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Synchronized swimming</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>3000-meter steeplechase </span></li>
</ol>
</td>

</tr>

Investors are also wary of growing U.S.-China tensions. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTRAVEL\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/04/carnival-announces-plans-resume-sailing?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nA Cruise? In This Pandemic?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Cruise line\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84MjkvY3J1aXNlX2xpbmUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn big news for ABBA cover bands and people who prefer not to fully rub in their sunscreen, Carnival Cruise Line \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/04/coronavirus-carnival-cruise-line-says-it-will-sail-again-august-1.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e it will resume sailing from select ports on August 1. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe stern story\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe cruise industry came under fire early in the pandemic for allowing the coronavirus to spread unchecked. 22% of active ships \u003ca href=\"https://www.miamiherald.com/news/business/tourism-cruises/article241914096.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e infections, according to the Miami Herald, and the Carnival-operated Diamond Princess had one of the earliest, and at the time biggest, outbreaks outside of China. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn early March, Carnival scrambled to soothe customer fears, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-08/carnival-cruises-offering-free-drinks-to-guests-who-don-t-cancel?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoffering free drinks\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to passengers who didn't cancel their reservations. But the CDC later dropped the anchor, instituting and then extending a “no sail order'' until July 24. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCustomers filed lawsuits seeking damages from Carnival, the operator responsible for 69% of total cruise ship cases. Now, Congress is \u003ca href=\"https://www.foxbusiness.com/markets/congress-carnival-cruises-coronavirus-response?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estepping in\u003c/a\u003e with its own investigation into Carnival's handling of the outbreaks.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHigh seas, low prices\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCarnival's trying to weather a sea of animosity by offering August trips for as little as $28 a day, which for some is \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-05-04/carnival-cruise-line-to-resume-sailing-aug-1-after-virus-halt?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echeaper than staying home\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThose bargain deals reflect the long road ahead for the broader travel industry. Take your pick from a buffet of \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/c5ad53fbaf1c2380d88508243ec51860?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003escary numbers\u003c/a\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGlobal travel demand won't reach its normal pace until 2023, according to estimates from Tourism Economics.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTrips of at least one night are expected to fall 30% this year after a record 1.5 billion in 2019.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e8 million U.S. workers whose jobs were related to tourism are now jobless, which represents about one-third of total unemployment.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eCarnival has not yet disclosed what precautions it will be taking to prevent further outbreaks. Until it does, $28/day cruises might not be enough to dispel passenger fears of jumping aboard another floating petri dish. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nAmazon Exec: \"I Quit in Dismay\"\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWorking at Amazon is nice, but living with a clear conscience is better, said a prominent VP who \u003ca href=\"https://www.tbray.org/ongoing/When/202x/2020/04/29/Leaving-Amazon?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eresigned\u003c/a\u003e from the company's cloud division Friday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe high-ranking software engineer, Tim Bray, said he was leaving over the company's firings of warehouse workers who spoke up about unsafe working conditions during the COVID-19 pandemic. Bray also mentioned the firing of two Amazon corporate employees who pressed the company over its environmental impact.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAmazon says these employees were fired for violating company policies, not their activism. Bray thinks otherwise, describing the activist firings as \"designed to create a climate of fear.\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAs Recode \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/recode/2020/5/4/21246361/amazon-vp-tim-bray-resigns-activist-firing-aws?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epoints out\u003c/a\u003e, Amazon doesn't hand out the VP badge like a participation trophy—only the upper echelon of managers earn the title. So when a BFD like Bray writes that \"Amazon treats the humans in the warehouses as fungible units of pick-and-pack potential,\" it shows that the company's ruthless drive for efficiency isn't shared by all members of the leadership team. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRobinhood, the app you know you shouldn't check constantly but you can't help yourself, \u003ca href=\"https://blog.robinhood.com/news/2020/5/4/robinhood-raises-280-million-in-series-f-funding-led-by-sequoia?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eAfter \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/02/robinhood-goes-historic-day-stock-market?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emajor glitches\u003c/a\u003e in early March cost customers action during a historic market rally, Robinhood beefed up capacity. Something worked, because it's added 3 million funded accounts this year (it reported 10 million total in December). In March, daily trading volume was nearly triple Q4 2019's average. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSolidifying Robinhood's status as first base for individual investors, half of new customers are newbies. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat about an IPO?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMany speculated Robinhood would ring the bell this year, but some analysts are skeptical of its business model. Robinhood earns some revenue by investing customers' cash balances—but that brings in less money now that the Fed gave interest rates a quarantine buzz cut.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCEO Vlad Tenev told Fortune he's \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/2020/05/04/robinhood-funding-series-f-global-expansion-sequoia-capital/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emoving forward\u003c/a\u003e with international expansion. Robinhood recently delayed plans for a U.K. launch, but 150,000 customers are hanging on the waiting list. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eBefore the pandemic, Robinhood was the \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/07/robinhood-clear-leader-among-investment-apps-analysis-shows?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eleader\u003c/a\u003e among investment apps.
